caseTitle: United Bank Ltd. v. Fateh Hayat Khan Tawana, etc
tagline: An application filed during the pendency of a timely first execution application cannot be considered a 'fresh application' because it elaborates or amends the pending first execution application. On the other hand, when a subsequent execution application has been filed after the disposal of the first execution application, the objection of limitation may be relevant. However, even in such a case, the subsequent execution application may survive notwithstanding its belated institution beyond six years after the decree under execution, if it satisfies the test and criteria of amendment of a previously disposed of execution application that had been filed timely.
